tags: plz i need data to analyze for school
body:
Consent form

Hey everyone!

So I’m doing a study on Critical Role and fan interactions with it and RPGs for a class I’m taking. I wasn’t allowed to post it in the discord for some reason (I think the admins may have thought there was money or promotions or something involved but whatever), and I really need responses, so if y’all could 1) take the survey if you’ve ever engaged with CR and 2) spread it around like wildfire, like reboot, send to friends, post/retweet on Twitter (I don’t have one), etc I’d really appreciate it! Thanks so much, and is it thursday yet?

blog.name: yfere
blog.title: just muddling through
blog.description: Alcin, 22. they/them. Critical Role and assorted nonsense

summary: Critrole spoilers. Me, seeing Caleb un-grossing himself: growth. Thirty seconds later: his ass is going to get recognized yeet....
question: Critrole spoilers. Me, seeing Caleb un-grossing himself: growth. Thirty seconds later: his ass is going to get recognized yeet. On the other hand, fjord, who’s so insecure, getting a pep talk and Nott, who’s hated herself especially in goblin form, being accepted by her husband and then gaining confidence in her appearance??? Good shit 👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻
answer:
Awwww, I’m sure it will be fine.

(Though, as much as Caleb seems not to like it, I personally like the scruffy bearded look for him)

Watching team Body Issues getting comfortable and getting support this ep was majorly satisfying, let me tell you.

summary: I really love Travis’ take on like a high charisma character because I feel like a lot of times people think high charisma...
body: I really love Travis’ take on like a high charisma character because I feel like a lot of times people think high charisma characters have to automatically know exactly how to be in every situation but with Fjord we do see him people watch and look at how other people interact to better his own interactions and I feel like in real life as human beings we do that. Like we look at how other people and how they’re perceived and in some ways we take those up sometimes, and idk I just think it’s really good and interesting and I just love variety so!

Like we look at how other people and how they’re perceived and in some ways we take those up sometimes, and idk I just think it’s really good and interesting and I just love variety so!

summary: Hey ya’ll!  Phew, that sure was a great episode right??? I see a lot of you all in the tags really appreciating Fjord after...

Hey ya’ll!

Phew, that sure was a great episode right??? I see a lot of you all in the tags really appreciating Fjord after everything that happened. Glad to have you! If you’re curious about everything we knew about Fjord leading up to this ep, I highly recommend reading this meta by @lavellenchanted where she talks about Fjord and identity!

tags: I'm gonna meta properly about the scene with Wirsh over the weekend
because there's a lot going on there
but I just wanted to point this out
summary: Just a reminder, because I’ve noticed it said a couple of times, this is not the first time that Fjord’s told the M9 that he was...
body:
Just a reminder, because I’ve noticed it said a couple of times, this is not the first time that Fjord’s told the M9 that he was an orphan, or bullied.

He talks about the bullying in episode 16, when he admitted to filing his tusks. In episode 21 when they were going in to fight the Merrow, there was some teasing that Fjord might be half-fish, there’s this little exchange revealing that Fjord doesn’t know who his parents were or what his bloodline is:

Nott: What is the other half?

Yasha: You’re half-orc, but what’s the other half?

Fjord: Half-human, I’d assume.

Yasha and Beau: You’d assume?  

And in episode 24 when they meet the Schuster children, Fjord asks the M9 to go with him to try and get their parents out specifically so they won’t have to go into an orphanage. When they ask him about it, he tells them it’s because he grew up in an orphanage himself and that, “They’re fucking terrible places.”

Other than Caduceus, the M9 have known about Fjord’s background for a while. As I’ve talked about before, he has by and large been reasonably open about his past. But what I think we saw yesterday - and I hope will be followed up on in future - is the realisation that it was a lot more traumatising for Fjord than they realised, and that he’s been hiding a lot of pain from them, and that his sensitivity about his image is tangled up with a lot of complicated issues about his race and background and his uncertainty about where he belongs.

Just a reminder, because I’ve noticed it said a couple of times, this is not the first time that Fjord’s told the M9 that he was an orphan, or bullied.

blog.name: hazelcephalopod
blog.title: Another Side of the Mirror
blog.description:
This has mostly turned into a CR blog-thing... I tag Thursday show until around Tuesday.

Hello peoples of Tumblr! This is my blog, which I make no promise to keep up with. I'm a bisexual Autistic. Also have ADD. I like cephalopods, especially cuttlefish, and plants, and reading, and many other geeky things.

More random tidbit: feminist, somewhere in the left politically, and tired of the political landscape but still trying to care. Also a lapsed pagan, it sounds like nonsense but idk how else to describe it. More things- gluten free, and crochet, knitting, and others. Beware of my many random posts as well.

That is all for now!

Oh BTW I am bad at tagging things, trying to get better, but its a work in progress.
